results.title: My man Godfrey
results.creator_credit: Gregory La Cava and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This is one of the classic screwball comedies of its time. An heiress (Carole Lombard), hires a butler (William Powell) after finding him on a scavenger hunt. She and her family are under the impression that he is a tramp without a job. He decides to teach “High Society” that money isn’t everything, and in the tradition of screwball comedy gets his girl as well as making his point. The film was unsuccessful at the Academy Awards despite six nominations but remains one of the best of its genre. Based on the novel by Eric Hatch.

results.title: Noise annoys
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Humorous look at the problem of excessive noise levels in an average Australian suburban street. One day the noise becomes too much for God and He intervenes. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Noel Coward: private lives
results.creator_credit: Laurence Rees, John Gorrie, Cedric Messina and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Tape 1 - Private Lives. On the first night of her honeymoon Amanda (Penelope Keith) feels that everything is perfect. The hotel room has a spectacular view, the cocktails are on the way and close by someone is singing a love song. To her horror she discovers that ‘someone’ is actually her ex-husband, also on honeymoon in a neighbouring hotel room. Noel Coward’s script is as relevant today as when it was first written in 1930 when he also played the lead role. The dialogue is quickly paced and full of wit and insightful observations. Tape 2 - Noel Coward: A Private Life. This is a biographical documentary about the life and early success of Noel Coward as a child actor and then as a playwright and performer in the 1920s and ‘30s through to the post war years. The documentary contains footage from his performances as well as interviews with those who knew him providing a revealing insight into Coward’s discrete private life that was significantly separate from his public image.

results.title: Noddy goes to the fair
results.creator_credit: Simon Bosanquet, Mark Hall, Brian Cosgrove, Chris Taylor, Stop Frame Productions and CPL
results.brief_description: Based on the Noddy stories by Enid Blyton. On a very windy day in Toy Town, a fair comes to town. Mr Plod tries to take away Noddy’s car, but when Bumby retrieves Mr Plod’s hat at the fair he lets Noddy go. Narrated by Richard Briers.

results.title: Nobody will speak of us when we are dead = Nadie hablara de nosotras cuando hayamos muerto [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Agustin Diaz Yanes, Edmundo Gil Casas, Renin, Xaloc SA and Flamenco Films SA
results.brief_description:
Gloria turns to prostitution to support her alcohol addiction after her bullfighter husband is seriously injured. We first see Gloria on the job for a group of Mexican money launderers. Things go awry when one of the clients, an undercover DEA agent is murdered. Gloria is the only witness, and after a pique of generosity, is handed a list of contacts in Spain. Eventually deported, Gloria returns to Madrid, contacts in hand, to the home of her mother-in-law and invalid husband determined to start a new life but is pursued by one of the hitmen. An interesting subplot involves his daughter’s illness exacerbated by her father’s profession, seemingly as an act of God. Hailed as a Spanish “Pulp fiction”, “Nobody will speak of us when we’re dead” received the 1995 Goya Award for Best Picture. In Spanish with English subtitles.
Cast includes: Victoria Abril, Pilar Bardem, Federico Luppi

results.title: Nobody waved good-bye
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of teenage conflict - the predicament of a youth who rebels against his parents’ middle-class goals and conventions. Away from home and high school he finds the world a cold place to go it alone. Ideals are no defence when the need dor money leads to shady practices. This feature film is a study of the sources of delinquency in an affluent society, mirroring many of the problems and frustrations of young people. Cast includes: Julie Biggs, Peter Kastner, Charmion King, Ron Taylor, John Vernon.

results.title: Noah's Ark
results.creator_credit: Bill Justice, Walt Disney and Disney Educational Productions
results.brief_description: An updated version of the old story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is done in an inventive three-dimensional animation technique that will be special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Stephen Jones and Babelsberg International Film Produktion
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.
